title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 1. (1) These Rules may be cited as the Nurses and Midwives (Education
text_raw:
1. (1) These Rules may be cited as the Nurses and Midwives (Education 

and Training) (Amendment) Rules 2020. 

(2) The Principal Rules and these Rules may be cited together as the 

Nurses and Midwives (Education and Training) Rules 2018 and 2020. 

Definition
text_norm: 1 (1) rule may cited nurse midwife (education training) (amendment) rule 2020 (2) principal rule rule may cited together nurse midwife (education training) rule 2018 2020 definition

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: In these Rules “Principal Rules” means the Nurses and Midwives
text_raw:
2. 

In these Rules “Principal Rules” means the Nurses and Midwives 

(Education and Training) Rules 2018 (S.I. No. 218 of 2018).

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 4. The Principal Rules are amended by substituting for Rule 5 the
text_raw:
4. The Principal Rules are amended by substituting for Rule 5 the 

following: 

“Return to practice programmes
text_norm: 4 principal rule amended substituting rule 5 following return practice programme

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 5. A person seeking admission to a return to practice education
text_raw:
5. A person seeking admission to a return to practice education 
and training programme for nurses or midwives must be 
registered, or have been previously registered, as a nurse or 
midwife with the Board.” 

Amendment of Rule 6 of Principal Rules
text_norm: 5 person seeking admission return practice education training programme nurse midwife must registered previously registered nurse midwife board amendment rule 6 principal rule

text_norm: 5 rule 6 principal rule amended substituting paragraph (1) following post-registration education training programme

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 6. (1) A person seeking admission to a post-registration education
text_raw:
6. (1) A person seeking admission to a post-registration education 
and training programme leading to registration in the midwives division 
of the register of nurses and midwives must be registered in the general 
nurses division of the register.”, and 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 6th November, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [501] 3 

in paragraphs (2) and (3), by substituting “a post-registration education 

and training programme” for “an education and training programme”.

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 9. The Principal Rules are amended by substituting for Rule 12 the
text_raw:
9. The Principal Rules are amended by substituting for Rule 12 the 

following: 

“Inspections of bodies and healthcare providers
text_norm: 9 principal rule amended substituting rule 12 following inspection body healthcare provider

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 12. (1) The Board shall appoint a team of persons with relevant
text_raw:
12. (1) The Board shall appoint a team of persons with relevant 
knowledge, experience and expertise (“a site inspection team”) to 
inspect bodies delivering, or seeking to deliver, education and training 
programmes, and their associated training facilities and healthcare 
providers, for the purposes of— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

assessing applications under Rule 9, 

carrying out reviews under Rule 11(1), and 

carrying out monitoring under Rule 11(2). 

(2) A person appointed to a site inspection team under paragraph 
(1) shall not have an interest that is likely to influence the outcome of 
the application under Rule 9, the review under Rule 11(1) or the 
monitoring under Rule 11(2), as the case may be. 

(3) A site inspection team shall not interfere with the delivery of the 

education and training programme in the course of its inspection. 

(4) A site inspection team shall, having carried out an inspection, 

report in writing to the Board. 

(5) A report pursuant to paragraph (4) may recommend that the 

Board— 

(a) grant its approval of a proposed education and training 

programme, 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

continue 
programme, 

its approval of an education and 

training 

grant its approval of a proposed education and training 
programme subject to certain specified conditions, 

continue 
its approval of an education and 
programme subject to certain specified conditions, 

training 

defer its decision on continued approval of an education and 
training programme pending 
the 
satisfaction of the Board, of specified issues of concern 
arising from the inspection, 

resolution, 

the 

to 

(f) 

refuse to grant approval of a proposed education and training 
programme on the basis of specified reasons, or 

(g) withdraw approval of an education and training programme 

on the basis of specified reasons.”. 

 
 
 
 [501] 5

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 10. Rule 13 of the Principal Rules is amended—
text_raw:
10. Rule 13 of the Principal Rules is amended— 

(a) by substituting for paragraph (1) the following: 

“Responses and resolutions following reporting of inspections
text_norm: 10 rule 13 principal rule amended-- (a) substituting paragraph (1) following response resolution following reporting inspection

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 13. (1) The Board, on receipt of a report of a site inspection
text_raw:
13. (1) The Board, on receipt of a report of a site inspection 
team under Rule 12, shall forthwith send a copy of the report to 
the body concerned and such body may, within such period (not 
being less than one month) as the Board may specify from time 
to time, submit to the Board its comments and observations on 
the factual accuracy of the report.”, 

(b) 

in paragraph (2)— 

(i) 

by substituting “inspection” for “visit” in both places in 
which it occurs, and 

(ii) by substituting “withdraw” for “refuse to continue its”, 

and 

(c) 

in paragraph (3), by substituting “withdrawing” for “refusing to 
continue its”. 

 
 
 
 6 [501]

 and Midwifery Board of Ireland, 

16 October, 2020. 

ESSENE CASSIDY, 

 President. 

SHEILA MCCLELLAND 

 Chief Executive Officer. 

I, STEPHEN DONNELLY, Minister for Health, approve of the making of the 
foregoing Rules. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 October, 2020. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY 

 Minister for Health.
